page.title: 15SEVERN VALLEY RAILWAY
page.content: The Severn Valley Railway is a full-size standard-gauge line running regular steam-hauled passenger trains for the use of tourists.It runs from Bridgnorth to Kidderminster and stops at 6 stations including Hampton Loade. The line closely follows the River Severn and makes the journey a very picturesque one indeed. Services run at weekends from the beginning of March until the end of October,at Bank Holidays,during the whole of Spring Bank Holiday week,and every day during peak holiday weeks. There are some full time workers employed but much of the work is undertaken by volunteers giving up their spare time to help preserve the line.
